Deepak Raju | People | Sidley Austin LLP Skip to content Menu Close People Services and Industries Insights About Sidley People Services and Industries Insights About Sidley Locations Site Language Updated Global  |  English News Community Inclusion Pro Bono Social Responsibility Sustainability Alumni Careers Home People Deepak Raju Counsel Deepak Raju Global Arbitration, Trade and Advocacy deepak.raju@sidley.com Geneva +41 22 308 0016 Letter A4 Jump to: Capabilities Capabilities News & Insights News & Insights Credentials Credentials DEEPAK RAJU is an international disputes lawyer with over 10 years of professional experience. Deepak represents clients in complex international disputes involving an economic, commercial, or geopolitical dimension. He advises sovereign States, international organizations, and companies before a wide range of forums of international dispute settlement, including investment and commercial arbitral tribunals, panels and the Appellate Body of the World Trade Organization, the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea, and the International Court of Justice. In 2025, Lexology honored Deepak with its Trade & Customs “Client Choice Award — Global Elite Thought Leader,” as well as Arbitration “Future Leader.” Deepak was also included by the India Business Law Journal in its “International A-List 2025,” which identifies “the most recommended foreign lawyers for India-related legal matters, based on the collective views of private practice lawyers in India and in-house counsel around the world.” Recent engagements include: Public International Law: Representing Antigua & Barbuda before the International Court of Justice (ICJ), in an advisory proceeding concerning climate change and its impacts. Representing the African Union before the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS), in an advisory proceeding concerning climate change and its effects on the marine environment. Advising a State on potential accession to the Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties. Advising a State on a potential State-to-State arbitration under a multilateral treaty concerning the organization of an international event. World Trade Organization: Representing the State of Qatar (Qatar) in an international litigation arising out of neighboring countries’ campaign of coercive economic measures. In one of these disputes at the WTO, Saudi Arabia – Protection of Intellectual Property Rights, Qatar became the first ever complainant to defeat a respondent’s invocation of the WTO’s national security exception in the 70-plus year history of the multilateral trade rules. Representing Airbus in the landmark Boeing-Airbus “large civil aircraft” subsidy disputes, the largest and longest-running disputes in the WTO’s history. Representing Qatar in defending a WTO dispute brought by the United Arab Emirates (the UAE). The UAE withdrew

So the story Start Here. I was looking for the program that suits me and I got one I was looking for, from there my love story start. so let’s consider the target name is xyz.com. I can’t disclose the target name obviously bug hunter and bug bounty platform policy. so the minimum payout for the program is a minimum of 200 $ so I was lucky that got that program. Same as every program information gathering was my first step if you don't know about information gathering click here . Simultaneously I was also looking for interesting endpoints in the main domain also knowns as the directory enumeration . After some time within 5 minutes, the lovely moment come I got the endpoint I was looking for from there the lovely turns came. The endpoint I got was /wp-JSON/ at that moment my mind tells me man there will be something you should look after it. Immediately I googled the wp-json HackerOne and I got one report. After that, I tried to implement the same scenario in my program and bingo. What I got is this xyz.com/busniess/wp-json/wp/v2/users/. Here is some list of reports I prefer for proof of concept link . I am really thankful to HackerOne . I had a lots of fun with that money. Hope you like it and love it for a more practical explanation. findings.subquery: Professional career and achievements of Deepak Raju Ghengat
key_findings: Deepak Raju is a Senior Associate at Sidley Austin, specializing in international arbitration and public international law.
He has contributed to significant cases, including the landmark WTO copyright case where Qatar secured victory against Saudi Arabia.
Raju has authored scholarly articles on international law, such as "General exceptions in the Indian model BIT: Is the 'necessity' test workable?" published in the Jindal Global Law Review.
He has also written on topics like the Kulbhushan Jadhav case and the implications of COVID-19 on jus cogens norms.
Raju has been involved in high-profile cases, including the beIN Corporation v. Kingdom of Saudi Arabia arbitration.
He has been recognized for his contributions to international law and arbitration.
He has been featured in publications like Lexology and Live Law for his insights on international legal matters.

final_report.executive_summary: Deepak Raju Ghengat is a multifaceted individual known for his contributions in various fields such as international law, astrophysics, and Hindustani classical music. He serves as a Senior Associate at Sidley Austin, specializing in international arbitration, where he has participated in landmark cases. He has authored significant legal articles and is recognized in the legal community. In astrophysics, he focused on lithium abundances in red giants, contributing research to NASA’s Astrophysics Data System. Additionally, there is a Deepak Raja, a scholar of Hindustani music, known for his writings on the subject. However, specific personal details and professional affiliations remain sparse across the sources examined.

His involvement in crucial cases, particularly the WTO copyright case and contributions to scholarly articles, demonstrates a strong legal foundation. His limited social media presence indicates a possibly private personal life or a focused professional orientation, which prioritizes scholarly contributions over public engagement.
